title: Chinese (1902) Wenli Holy Scriptures of the Old and New Testaments
title_vernacular: 中文 (1902) 文理旧新约全书
description: The Wenli Holy Scriptures is a Chinese Bible translated by Robert Morrison. It was published in 1902. Morrison was an Anglo-Scottish missionary who is considered the "Father of Anglo-Chinese Literature." Standard Chinese, known in China as Putonghua, based on the Mandarin dialect of Beijing, is the official national spoken language for the Chinese mainland and Taiwan.

language.name: Mandarin Chinese
language.area: Widespread north of Changjiang River, a belt south of the Changjiang from Qiujiang (Jiangxi) to Zhenjiang (Jiangsu), Hubei, except southeast corner, Sichuan, Yunnan, Guizhou, northwest part of Guangxi, and northwest corner of Hunan. Also in Brunei, Cambodia, Canada, Indonesia (Java and Bali), Laos, Libya, Malaysia (Peninsular), Mauritius, Mongolia, Mozambique, Philippines, Russian Federation (Asia), Singapore, Taiwan, Thailand, United Kingdom, United States, Viet Nam, Zambia.
